condition.narrative: Advisory Board- Section I. A3 of Schedule 2 to the Financial Agreement: The Recipient shall establish by four months afterEffectiveness date, and thereafter maintain, throughout the period of Project implementation, the following advisory boards, with amandate, composition and resources satisfactory to the Association: (a) the Grant Advisory Committee; and (b) the Technology CenterAdvisory Board.

Bid/ Proposal Evaluation Committees for Internationally Advertised Contracts - Section I. A4 of Schedule 2 to the FinancialAgreement: Prior to the procurement of internationally advertised contracts for works, IT systems, and consulting services throughfirms to be financed out of the proceeds of the Credit; the Recipient shall establish, and thereafter maintain, throughout theperiod of Project implementation a bid/proposal evaluation committee in a manner acceptable to the Association. Such committeeshall be composed by at least five (5) members including two (2) international/national technical experts, two (2) members of theProject Implementation Unit (PIU) including one (1) local procurement consultant, and one (1) member from MOC.

Expenditures to be Exclusively Financed with Counterpart Funds- Section I. H2 of Schedule 2 to the Financial Agreement: TheRecipient shall: (a) ensure that the following expenditures are financed exclusively out of its own resources or other resources ofthe Recipient and not out of the proceeds of the Credit; and (b) provide, promptly as needed, the resources needed for thispurpose: (i) all land required for the purposes of the Project; (ii) all resettlement and rehabilitation compensation and otherassistance to Affected Persons in accordance with the RAPs; (iii) recurrent expenditures such as workshop allowances, sittingallowances, cash per diems, honoraria and fuel; and (iv) vehicles.

Export Readiness Fund (“ERF”) under Part 1(b) of the Project- Section I. C1(a) of Schedule 2 to the Financial Agreement: Forpurposes of Part 1(b) of the Project, the Recipient shall identify an ERF Manager acceptable to the Association and enter into, andthereafter maintain throughout the period of implementation of the ERF, a management agreement with the ERF Manager under terms andconditions acceptable to the Association.

Project Implementation Manual, Matching Grant Manual for Part 1(b) of the Project and PIFIC Operating Guidelines for Part 3 of theProject- Section I. B1 of Schedule 2 to the Financial Agreement: The Recipient shall adopt by no later than one (1) month after theEffective Date, and thereafter maintain throughout the period of implementation of the Project, the Project Implementation Manualand the PIFIC Operating Guidelines.

Project Implementation Manual, Matching Grant Manual for Part 1(b) of the Project and Public Investment Facility for InfrastructureConstraints (PIFIC) Operating Guidelines for Part 3 of the Project- Section I. B2 of Schedule 2 to the Financial Agreement: TheRecipient shall carry out Part 1(b) of the Project in accordance with the Matching Grant Manual and Part 3 of the Project inaccordance with the PIFIC Operating Guidelines; and except as the Association shall otherwise agree in writing, not assign, amend,abrogate, or waive, or permit to be assigned, amended, abrogated, or waived, the Matching Grant Manual, the PIFIC OperatingGuidelines and/or any provision thereof. In the event of a conflict between the provisions of the Matching Grant Manual or thePIFIC Manual and those of this Agreement, the latter shall govern.

Project Implementation Unit- Section I. A2 of Schedule 2 to the Financial Agreement: The Recipient shall establish within one monthafter Effectiveness date, and thereafter maintain, throughout the period of Project implementation, a Project Implementation Unitwithin MOC, with functions and resources satisfactory to the Association, and with staff in adequate numbers and withqualifications, experience and terms of reference satisfactory to the Association.

Project Steering Committee (PSC)- Section I.A1 of Schedule 2 to the Financial Agreement: The Recipient shall maintain, throughoutthe period of Project implementation, the Project Steering Committee, to be formed within one month after Effectiveness date, witha mandate, composition and resources satisfactory to the Association. Without limitation on the foregoing, the PSC shall: (a) bechaired by the Secretary of Ministry of Commerce (MOC) and comprise representatives from relevant ministries and associations; and(b) meet as frequently as necessary to: (i) provide strategic and policy direction on all Project activities; (ii) facilitate thecoordination of Project activities; and (iii) address any obstacle during Project implementation.

Public Investment Facility for Infrastructure Constrains (“PIFIC”) under Part 3 of the Project- Section I. E1 of Schedule 2 to theFinancial Agreement: For purposes of Part 3 of the Project, the Recipient shall, by no later than nine (9) months after theEffective Date, hire, and thereafter maintain throughout the period of implementation of the Project, responsible for supportingthe PIU in carrying out the procurement evaluations and bidding documents relating to activities under Part 3 of the Project.

Safeguards- Section I. G1 of Schedule 2 to the Financial Agreement:The Recipient shall ensure that the Project is carried out inaccordance with the provisions of the EMF, the SMF, the RPF, the SETDCDF and the relevant Safeguard Assessments and Plans.

Safeguards- Section I. G3 of Schedule 2 to the Financial Agreement: Whenever an additional or revised Safeguard Assessment and Planshall be required for any proposed Project activity, in accordance with the provisions of the Environmental management Framework(EMF), the Social Management Framework (SMF), the Resettlement Policy Framework (RPF) and the Small, Ethnic, Tribal, and otherDisadvantaged Communities Development Framework (SETDCDF), as the case may be, the Recipient shall:(a) prior to the commencementof such activity, proceed to have such Safeguard Assessment and Plan: (i) prepared and publicly consulted on in accordance with theprovisions of the EMF, the SMP, the RPF and the SETDCDF, as the case may be; (ii) furnished to the Association for review andapproval; and (iii) thereafter adopted and disclosed as approved by the Association, in a manner acceptable to the Association;(b) thereafter take such measures as shall be necessary or appropriate to ensure compliance with the requirements of suchSafeguard Assessment and Plan; and(c) in the case of any resettlement activity under the Project involving Affected Persons,ensure that no displacement shall occur before necessary resettlement measures consistent with the Resettlement Action Plan (RAP)applicable to such activity have been executed, including, in the case of displacement, full payment to Affected Persons ofcompensation and of other assistance required for relocation, prior to displacement.

Section I. C2 of Schedule 2 to the Financial Agreement: Prior to making a Matching Grant, the Recipient shall cause the ERF Managerto enter into a grant agreement with each Selected Firm under terms and conditions acceptable to the Association.

Section I. E2 (a) of Schedule 2 to the Financial Agreement: Prior to the carrying out of any infrastructure investment under Part 3of the Project, the Recipient shall, enter into an agreement with the Beneficiary Group in accordance with the terms and conditionsacceptable to the Association.
